name: Detecting Victim Signals
description: Recognizing the behavioral, verbal, and nonverbal cues that indicate human trafficking victims.

cards.title: Behavioral and Psychological Indicators
cards.description: Understanding the psychological impact of trafficking and the behavioral signals victims display.
bulletpoints: Signs of coercion: scripted responses, extreme submissiveness, avoidance of eye contact.
Victims often show signs of PTSD, malnutrition, and physical injuries from abuse.
Understanding Stockholm Syndrome and how victims may defend their captors.
cards.summaryText: Read coercion tells, log trauma symptoms, and factor in captor-bond dynamics.

cards.title: Physical and Environmental Clues
cards.description: Recognizing red flags in workplaces, transit hubs, and public spaces.
bulletpoints: Identifying common locations where trafficking victims are kept or moved.
Understanding the role of fake job offers and fraudulent recruitment schemes.
Spotting signs of trafficking at hotels, massage parlors, nightclubs, and transit centers.
cards.summaryText: Scan high-risk venues, debunk bogus recruitment fronts, and watch transit hotspots for tells.

cards.title: Reporting and Safe Extraction
cards.description: Proper channels for reporting and assisting trafficking victims without putting them at greater risk.
bulletpoints: Understanding how to contact anti-trafficking organizations and law enforcement.
How to document and report trafficking suspicions without alerting traffickers.
When and how to intervene directly in a way that does not endanger the victim.
cards.summaryText: Route intel to trusted responders, document discreetly, and time interventions to keep victims safe.
